ygData.subject: RE: New Lullaby theory
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I ll test it more throughly again in the next couple days. My subjective impression is that Pixie Strike has been working *slightly* better, but the
ygData.messageBody:
On Wed, 23 Feb 2000, Peck White wrote:
>
> I regretfully tell you that I was a couple of levels below level 15 when the
> patch that nerfed Lullaby went in, so I've never seen what it could do
> pre-nerf. My experience with lullaby even at level 15 was that "it's a
> great taunt song". I've never been able to reliably crowd control to this
> date. I guess when I get charm in four more levels I'll be able to control
> a crowd of three, but if pixie strike is as bugged as Lullaby I guess that
> will be the best I will ever do.

I'll test it more throughly again in the next couple days.
My subjective impression is that Pixie Strike has been working
*slightly* better, but the duration has been shortened. i.e.
I'm getting enough successes that I can keep 1, sometimes 2
mobs slept, but rather than lasting the "full 3 ticks" like it
usually did before, it seems to be expiring early more often.
Then again, it may be my having gained 2 levels since the last
time I really tried to control bats and bugs.

Heck, maybe I'll try Lullaby next time we get two bats, just
to see how it works against L42ish mobs. :)

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
